productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #28,188 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry (See Top 100 in Clothing, Shoes & Jewelry) #21 in Women's Wool & Pea Coats

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Love this coat! I wasn't expecting too much for the price, but the quality is surprisingly decent!It's the perfect weight (not too heavy or bulky). The fabric blend is not scratchy at all- it's actually soft. I can't stand scratchy wool, it really irritates me!! I also don't like feeling confined by giant heavy coats, so this one is really comfortable.It's also very flattering, if coats can be considered "flattering" instead of just functional?It's fully lined with two large exterior pockets (big enough to hold my phone, keys, gloves, etc.). I like the length as well- it hits me just above the knee.For reference, I'm 5'3", about 140 pounds, big chested with broad shoulders. I ordered a large and it's a perfect fit, even with a sweater and buttoned up.I hope this helps, I'm honestly really happy I took a gamble on this coat!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Comfortable and tylish
reviews.reviewText: I have worn the coat only a few times and have already received lots of compliments, most have said "what a stylish coat". I love the fit and look of this coat so much that I plan to get another one in a different color. It's quite warm enough for San Francisco winter, it gets as low as 30 degrees here but usually the temperature hovers around 56 degrees, so it probably will not be warm enough for an East coast winter but would work well for an East coast Fall.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I really like this coat! Seems like most women’s wool coats here in America have a tightly tailored upper trying to create a ‘desired’ silhouette. But I appreciate the oversized, gender neutral, minimalist style of this coat. It is a versatile layer for work, a dressy event and even just trying to step up your running errands look. It is exactly what I wanted.I am 5’3”, an inverted triangle shape (broad shoulders, 38DDD, slimmer straight hips) and I love the fit. It is oversized, but I also ordered up a size (XL) because I don’t like fitted things on my upper body, and I don’t want my bust squeezed in and smushed look when buttoned up. This coat is double breasted, but the buttons hit below the bust line and creates a nice deep V that I like. The length hits me mid calf which is what I wanted. The sleeves are about and inch to long, but I know how to hem them up because the arms are always to long for me.The reviews were mixed on the weight and warmth, but it is plenty warm for me to wear to work everyday in DC winters. A scarf on cold days, to warm up the neck and gloves and I’ll be good to go. It is not as heavy as some wool coats, buts it’s got a nice weight to it. The label says 85%polyester and 15% wool.The coat will need a quick steam or ironing right out of the package, but the creases did come out easily for me. The only thing I don’t like about the coat is that it attracts all the lint within like a four foot area, it’s a magnet. I got the solid black so it is a little annoying, but I do think this is a trait of most wool blended coats.At right around $65, I would say it’s a good value, I have no doubt I will get at least a few winter seasons from this coat. It feels well made.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice coat!
reviews.reviewText: Gift for my daughter in law! Sized up and it was perfect. Color is accurate to listing photo. Plaid does not align on seams but most plaid coats do not unless higher end purchase. Great quality for the price! She loved it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Fits great! Good quality
reviews.reviewText: This coat fits me great. I’m 5’4”,140 pounds. I can easily wear a light to medium weight sweater underneath. The length hits me right below my knees. It’s good quality and I would say it’s medium weight. Not too heavy and not too light. I purchased the plaid one first and loved the way it fit so I purchased the black too. I’m very happy with my purchase.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: this item runs very small. I can wear a xl. Can't get arms thru sleeves. won't button. Fabric cheap. would not recommend buying it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars I had high hopes
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to love this coat but two things. The first wasn't a deal breaker because I think the coat is cute. The fabric is lighter and more wrinkly than anticipated. But I might have steamed it and worn it for warmer days. However, the second point. I ordered an XL. All my other clothes fit well as an XL (US 16). This coat, according to the measurements, fit the upper half of my body. It closed and all. But it's as if the makers of this coat did not factor in women's hips. If you have womanly hips or a derrière, I would maybe size up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth the Cost
reviews.reviewText: Kept me warm and stylish. Originally ordered an XL for my larger chest. It was roomier than I thought ended up with a size L.
La taille est parfait , très bonne qualité

reviews.reviewTitle: Cute but not a winter coat
reviews.reviewText: Love this for fall. Looks horrible buttoned up as it has no shape but I love wearing it open. Have gotten lots of compliments. I'm usually between a medium and a large so I went with the large and it's perfect for layering. No bad smell, quality seems good for the price, not warm but that's ok. I'm 5'4" and it lands right at the knee. Thinking of getting it hemmed because I'd prefer it it be just over or under the knee.
Really poor quality coat, lots of stray threads. Smelled strongly of mildew when it arrived. Vendor would not accept a return, only agreed to refund 50% of cost.

5'1" tall, 160 pounds, XL fits better. The Large fit, but was too tight in hips when buttoned up. Comes to mid-calf. Sleeves are 3 inches too long. This coat is too expensive at $88 that's for sure. It's cheaply made and thin. A button came off as soon as I pulled it out of the package. This is not really a coat, it's too thin and not warm enough to call it a coat. It's also very clingy in the hips and should be more A-line. If it was a heavier material, it would not cling and would look better. A hoodie or a sweater would have more warmth. It's probably worth no more than $50 at the time of writing. China is taking advantage and not giving fair market value, that's for sure. I'm sending it back.
